```{r aggregate all plots, fig.width = 10, fig.height = 7}
pointsToLine <- function(data, lon, lat, id_field = NULL, sort_field = NULL) {

  # Convert to SpatialPointsDataFrame
  coordinates(data) <- c(lon, lat)

  # If there is a sort field...
  if (!is.null(sort_field)) {
    if (!is.null(id_field)) {
      data <- data[order(data[[id_field]], data[[sort_field]]), ]
    } else {
      data <- data[order(data[[sort_field]]), ]
    }
  }

  # If there is only one path...
  if (is.null(id_field)) {

    lines <- SpatialLines(list(Lines(list(Line(data)), "id")))

    return(lines)

    # Now, if we have multiple lines...
  } else if (!is.null(id_field)) {  

    # Split into a list by ID field
    paths <- sp::split(data, data[[id_field]])

    sp_lines <- SpatialLines(list(Lines(list(Line(paths[[1]])), "line1")))

    # I like for loops, what can I say...
    for (p in 2:length(paths)) {
      id <- paste0("line", as.character(p))
      l <- SpatialLines(list(Lines(list(Line(paths[[p]])), id)))
      sp_lines <- spRbind(sp_lines, l)
    }

    return(sp_lines)
  }
}


mammalTickLines <- pointsToLine(mammalTickPlots, lon = 'lon', lat = 'lat', id_field = 'mammalTick')
plantMammalLines <- pointsToLine(plantMammalPlots, lon = 'lon', lat = 'lat', id_field = 'plantMammal')
```

```{r plot mammal, fig.width = 10}
mammal <- read.csv(paste0(mapath, 'mammal.csv')) %>%
  mutate(collectDate = ymd(collectDate))

ggplot(data = mammal) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = collectDate, y = total/totalTraps, col = siteID), alpha = 1/10) +
  geom_line(aes(x = collectDate, y = total/totalTraps, col = siteID), stat="smooth",method = "loess", alpha = 9/10) +
  scale_x_date(breaks = pretty_breaks()) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 1)) +
  xlab('Collection date') +
  ylab('Relative mammal abundance') +
  theme_minimal()
```

```{r plot tick, fig.width = 10}
tick <- read.csv(paste0(tapath, 'tick.csv')) %>%
  mutate(collectDate = ymd(collectDate))

ggplot(data = tick) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = collectDate, y = totalCount/totalSampledArea, col = siteID), alpha = 1/5) + 
  geom_line(aes(x = collectDate, y = totalCount/totalSampledArea, col = siteID), stat="smooth",method = "loess", alpha = 9/10) +
  scale_x_date(breaks = pretty_breaks()) + 
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 1)) + # scale cuts off outliers from view to better visualize trends
  xlab('Collection date') + 
  ylab('Relative tick abundance') +
  theme_minimal()
```

```{r plot tick on top of mammals, fig.width = 10}
ggplot(data = NULL) + 
  geom_point(data = mammal, aes(x = collectDate, y = total/totalTraps), colour = '#56B4E9', alpha = 1/10) +
  geom_point(data = tick, aes(x = collectDate, y = totalCount/totalSampledArea), colour = '#009E73', alpha = 1/10) +
  geom_line(data = mammal, aes(x = collectDate, y = total/totalTraps, colour = 'mammal'), stat="smooth",method = "loess", alpha = 9/10) +
  geom_line(data = tick, aes(x = collectDate, y = totalCount/totalSampledArea, colour = 'tick'), 
            stat="smooth",method = "loess", alpha = 9/10) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 1)) +
  xlab('Collection date') +
  ylab('Relative abundance') +
  facet_wrap(vars(siteID)) + 
  scale_colour_manual(name = '', values = c(mammal = '#56B4E9', tick = '#009E73')) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')
  
```

```{r mammal-tick results lag, fig.width = 10}
load(paste0(rpath, 'mtTotalLag2Output.rdata'))

# parameter CI

cred <- mtTotalLag2Output$parameters$betaStandXWTable %>%
  rownames_to_column %>%
  separate(rowname, c('tick','predictor'), sep = '_') %>%
  mutate(tick = factor(tick, levels = c('larvaCount', 'nymphCount', 'adultCount'))) %>%
  mutate(bottom = if_else(CI_025 < 0, -1, 1), top = if_else(CI_975 < 0, -1, 1)) %>%
  mutate(sig = bottom + top) %>%
  mutate(significance = as.factor(case_when(sig == -2 ~ 'negative relationship',
                                  sig == 0 ~ 'non-significant',
                                  sig == 2 ~ 'positive relationship'))) %>%
  select(-sig, -bottom, -top)

tickLab <- c(`adultCount` = 'adult stage',
             `larvaCount` = 'larva stage',
             `nymphCount` = 'nymph stage')

ggplot(cred, aes(x = predictor, y = Estimate, col = significance)) + 
  geom_point() +
  facet_wrap(vars(tick), labeller = labeller(tick = tickLab)) +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = CI_025, ymax = CI_975)) +
  scale_color_manual(values=c("#999999", "#56B4E9")) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')

```

```{r mammal-tick results species, fig.width = 10}
load(paste0(rpath, 'mtHostOutput1.rdata'))

# parameter CI

cred <- mtHostOutput1$parameters$betaStandXWTable %>%
  rownames_to_column %>%
  separate(rowname, c('tick','predictor'), sep = '_') %>%
  mutate(tick = factor(tick, levels = c('larvaCount', 'nymphCount', 'adultCount'))) %>%
  mutate(species = substr(predictor, 1, 4), year = substr(predictor, 5, 8)) %>%
  select(-predictor) %>%
  mutate(bottom = if_else(CI_025 < 0, -1, 1), top = if_else(CI_975 < 0, -1, 1)) %>%
  mutate(sig = bottom + top) %>%
  mutate(significance = as.factor(case_when(sig == -2 ~ 'negative relationship',
                                  sig == 0 ~ 'non-significant',
                                  sig == 2 ~ 'positive relationship'))) %>%
  select(-sig, -bottom, -top)

tickLab <- c(`adultCount` = 'adult stage',
             `larvaCount` = 'larva stage',
             `nymphCount` = 'nymph stage')

ggplot(cred, aes(x = species, y = Estimate, col = significance)) + 
  geom_point() +
  facet_wrap(tick ~ year, labeller = labeller(tick = tickLab)) +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = CI_025, ymax = CI_975)) +
  scale_color_manual(values=c("#E69F00", "#999999", "#56B4E9")) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom') +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

```

```{r plot genera per site, fig.width = 10, fig.height = 7}
pppath <- '/Users/taylorminich/Documents/grad/mp/data/plants/processed/'

BART <- read.csv(paste0(pppath, 'BART.csv')) %>%
  filter(measurementHeight > 100) %>%
  filter(plantStatus != 'Dead, broken bole' | plantStatus != 'Standing dead') %>%
  filter(genus != 'Unknown') %>%
  select(-uid.x, -plotID, -taxonID, -year, -plantStatus, -measurementHeight, -growthForm) %>%
  group_by(individualID) %>%
  summarise(stemDiameter = mean(stemDiameter), code = first(code), genus = first(genus)) %>%
  mutate(siteID = 'BART')

tree <- bind_rows(BART, BLAN, GRSM, HARV, OSBS, SCBI, SERC) %>%
  count(siteID, genus) %>%
  arrange(siteID, desc(n)) %>%
  group_by(siteID) %>%
  mutate(prop = n/sum(n)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  mutate(order = row_number())

ggplot(tree) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = order, y = prop), stat = 'identity') +
  facet_wrap(vars(siteID), scales = 'free_x', ncol = 2) +
  scale_x_continuous(
  breaks = tree$order,
  labels = tree$genus,
  expand = c(0,0)
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))
```
